title: Udemy - SEO For Udemy - Scott Duffy
description:
SEO For Udemy - Scott Duffy

URL: https://www.udemy.com/seo-udemy-seo/



Course Description:

New course, launched February 2015. Four lectures added March 2015.

ELEVEN FIVE-STAR REVIEWS!!! THANK YOU!!!

Alan K says, "Scott is a great teacher and is very knowledgeable I bought his course watched the content for less than two hours made a few changes he suggested and my course moved up the ranking of my niche from page two to page one within two hours .... thanks Scott"

SEO on Udemy is somewhat mysterious, as there are no step-by-step guides that exist that tell you exactly how to choose your URL, edit your title, and what exactly to say in your description. Udemy at it's heart is a search engine running on top of a marketplace, and so it HAS to have a way of ordering courses from 1 to 20000 in the order that makes the most sense for what the student is searching for at the time. SEO absolutely can work on Udemy, you just need to know a few things about how it works.

There are not many sources to explain how it works, and not much research into it. Udemy themselves do not explain how search works. But we can derive some SEO conclusions, both from what we see when we do searches, and from experience working behind the scenes with other search engines.

Knowing Google SEO will only help a little. Udemy's search engine is not as sophisticated as Google's. And there are very limited ways we can modify our course.

What are the requirements?

You should have a course in mind to create or have a course already live
Know who your target students are
Know what words (keywords) those students might use to search for your course
What am I going to get from this course?

Over 33 lectures and 2.5 hours of content!
Understand how the Udemy search engine works
Know how to choose a URL for your course
Know how long and what words to use in your title
Know how many times to use your keywords in your course description
Understand the difference between Google Search and Udemy search
What is the target audience?

People with courses on Udemy
People who want to understand how Udemy search determines top results
Instructors researching their potential course
